title: Potential energy - block on spring moved

content.question: A block is attached to a compressed, horizontal spring. A person is initially holding the block in place at position <math alttext="x equals negative A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mtext>A</mtext></math> as shown in the figure. The person then slowly moves the block at a constant speed through position <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, at which point the spring is at its relaxed length, and then to position <math alttext="x equals positive A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>A</mtext></math>. Which of the following correctly describes how the potential energy in the spring-block system changes as the block is moved from <math alttext="x equals negative A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mtext>A</mtext></math> to <math alttext="x equals positive A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>A</mtext></math>?

choices.label: The potential energy decreases throughout the motion
The potential energy increases throughout the motion
The potential energy decreases and then increases
The potential energy increases and then decreases

content.answer: The potential energy decreases and then increases

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
